org.fife.rsta.ui

Class CollapsibleSectionPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.fife.rsta.ui.CollapsibleSectionPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class CollapsibleSectionPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A panel that can show or hide contents anchored to its bottom via a shortcut. Those contents "slide" in, since today's applications are all about fancy smancy animations.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Robert Futrell
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • addBottomComponent

        public void addBottomComponent(javax.swing.JComponent comp)
        Adds a "bottom component." To show this component, you must call showBottomComponent(JComponent) directly. Any previously displayed bottom component will be hidden.
        Parameters:
        comp - The component to add.
        See Also:
        addBottomComponent(KeyStroke, JComponent)

      • addBottomComponent

        public javax.swing.Action addBottomComponent(javax.swing.KeyStroke ks,
                                             javax.swing.JComponent comp)
        Adds a "bottom component" and binds its display to a key stroke. Whenever that key stroke is typed in a descendant of this panel, this component will be displayed. You can also display it programmatically by calling showBottomComponent(JComponent).
        Parameters:
        ks - The key stroke to bind to the display of the component. If this parameter is null, this method behaves exactly like the addBottomComponent(JComponent) overload.
        comp - The component to add.
        Returns:
        An action that displays this component. You can add this action to a JMenu, for example, to alert the user of a way to display the component.
        See Also:
        addBottomComponent(JComponent)

      • createTimer

        private void createTimer()

      • focusMainComponent

        private void focusMainComponent()
        Attempt to focus the "center" component of this panel.

      • getDisplayedBottomComponent

        public javax.swing.JComponent getDisplayedBottomComponent()
        Returns the currently displayed bottom component.
        Returns:
        The currently displayed bottom component. This will be null if no bottom component is displayed.

      • hideBottomComponent

        public void hideBottomComponent()
        Hides the currently displayed "bottom" component with a slide-out animation.
        See Also:
        showBottomComponent(JComponent)

      • installKeystrokes

        private void installKeystrokes()
        Installs standard keystrokes for this component.

      • setAnimationTime

        public void setAnimationTime(int millis)
        Sets the amount of time, in milliseconds, it should take for a "collapsible panel" to show or hide. The default is 120.
        Parameters:
        millis - The amount of time, in milliseconds.

      • showBottomComponent

        private void showBottomComponent(CollapsibleSectionPanel.BottomComponentInfo bci)
        Displays a new "bottom" component. If a component is currently displayed at the "bottom," it is hidden.
        Parameters:
        bci - The new bottom component.
        See Also:
        hideBottomComponent()

      • showBottomComponent

        public void showBottomComponent(javax.swing.JComponent comp)
        Displays a previously-registered "bottom component."
        Parameters:
        comp - A previously registered component.
        See Also:
        addBottomComponent(JComponent), addBottomComponent(KeyStroke, JComponent), hideBottomComponent()

        public void updateUI()
